title: Learn Finnish Verbs | 'Type 3 Sin√§, H√§n, Me, Te & He Verbs' | Verbityyppi 3 (Part 2)

media:group.media:title: Learn Finnish Verbs | 'Type 3 Sin√§, H√§n, Me, Te & He Verbs' | Verbityyppi 3 (Part 2)
media:group.media:description:
Continuing with verbs today. This is part 2 of my "Learning Finnish Type 3 Verbs" Series!üòä

This continues the so called 'Type 3 verbs/Verbityyppi 3' in Finnish. I will be going over the verb conjugations for the rest of the pronouns (sin√§, h√§n, me, te and he). 

Following videos will go over negative sentences, some KPT examples and also verbs that are exceptions. 

A summary: 
‚óè Verbs belonging to verbityyppi 3 end in: -lla/-ll√§, -sta/-st√§, -nna/-nn√§, -ra/-r√§
‚óè To make a sin√§ (you) sentence, remove the LAST 2 letters of the verb, add -e and add the sin√§ (you) marker -t
‚óè To make a h√§n (s/he) sentence, remove the LAST 2 letters of the verb, add -e and add the h√§n (s/he) marker -e
‚óè To make a me (we) sentence, remove the LAST 2 letters of the verb, add -e and add the me (we) marker -mme
‚óè To make a te (you plural) sentence, remove the LAST 2 letters of the verb, add -e and add the te (you plural) marker -tte
‚óè To make a he (they) sentence, remove the LAST 2 letters of the verb, add -e and add the he (they) marker -vat/v√§t (depends on vowel harmony)
‚óè I didn't show an example in this video, but consonant gradation CAN happen. So don't be too shocked if you come across this when practicing (more on this in another video)
